storyInfo: The Self-Salvation Corps find themselves betrayed by the factory workers while evacuating from Highbury Borough. Catherine is held hostage, while Clovisia has disappeared.

attributes.content: So this is all the Londinium Citizens' Self-Salvation Corps men... who evacuated the city.
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: We suffered greater losses than I imagined.
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: Some decided to stay. Even though the Sarkaz destroyed our stronghold, that doesn't mean they have a list of our collaborators.
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: We don't know exactly how bad the leak was, and a lot of our men think things aren't really that bad yet.
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: Hmph, they still pretend they can go back to their quiet, peaceful lives.
attributes.name: Rockrock

attributes.content: Can't they see we have nowhere to run?
attributes.name: Rockrock

attributes.content: Don't say that, Rockrock. Most of them aren't fighters. They are just willing to place their hopes on us.
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: Most of the people who stand with us... aren't.
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: Soldiers who don't know who they should be loyal to, journalists who lost their jobs, workers sick of Sarkaz exploitation...
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: Normal folk who have had enough.
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: The Londinium Citizens' Self-Salvation Corps were formed by men like them.
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: To leave Londinium... the place that we called home since we were born... is a lot more than delivering intel, forging a few weapons, and fighting the Sarkaz mercenaries...
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: It's to find where you belong in a real war with no end in sight and may end up dragging any number of people into actual turmoil. This is truly horrible.
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: This is our Londinium. We should rely on no one but ourselves to defend it... That's what we used to think, at first.
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: We thought we had been giving it our all to fight that horror...
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: But when it finally arrived... it turned out to be far more than we could actually bear.
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: To tell the truth, I don't know what fate has in store for us from here onwards. We have some new friends now, but the enemy has now truly bared their fangs.
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: We may soon find ourselves annihilated, become wandering ghosts that drift the wilderness, and in the end disperse all over...
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: Clovisia, stop being so gloomy.
attributes.name: Rockrock

attributes.content: I came here only because I don't want to be handed a liberation by anyone.
attributes.name: Rockrock

attributes.content: That's why we are all here.
attributes.name: Rockrock

attributes.content: I'm a worker. I'm not one to talk about righteousness. All I know is that the workpieces I knock out are the most trustworthy.
attributes.name: Rockrock

attributes.content: I want to save my city from those people hiding in the palaces and castles. I can't do it alone, but I found you.
attributes.name: Rockrock

attributes.content: If we don't have what it takes together, we'll unite more people. If we still fail in the end...
attributes.name: Rockrock

attributes.content: Then fine. I'll accept that outcome.
attributes.name: Rockrock

attributes.content: Hey, Rockrock, we're still far from talking about outcomes!
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Now hurry up and walk faster. A stinking passageway like this isn't good for your wounded men's health.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Right, the air in the countryside should be better than inside Londinium.
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: Based on Rhodes Island's analysis, we should enter a branch of the Sarkaz's supply line up ahead.
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: We're back.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: Granny, what is the situation like?
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: It's safe. We didn't run into any sentries, and there are no signs of patrols. It looks to be a maintenance access. There are some instruments there, although I have the faintest idea what they are for.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: But it's strange. We couldn't find where that real 'supply line' was.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: Nonetheless, the access should be more than enough for an evacuation right now.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: Now hurry up, boy. Have your little friends get off their arses. A moment of safety doesn't mean peace forever.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: Okay. I got it.
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: I'll take a look at the equipment we took. There might be something we can put to use. The crawlers that got written off might still be usable, if luck's on our side.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: Granny!
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: It's not that I don't believe in what we're doing, and I'm not losing heart over this setback.
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: We... We can come back, right?
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: What kind of answer do you want me to give you?
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: I've been cheering everyone up, but I've never really left this place myself.
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: On top of that, we're leaving like this.
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: Feist, I used to think every so often that... we're actually pretty lucky.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: We were born in this city, we have trustworthy friends and jobs that are worth doing.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: And at the weekends, we can even head to the pubs in the alleys for a pint, play some cards, and maybe win some change.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: Of course, Victoria has never been truly at peace.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: The things we make are sent to the border region to fight the Sargonians or the Leithanians and blast holes in their bodies—Not that it has anything to do with us.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: All we had to do was stay in the factory and turn screws on the iron blocks.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: We suffered pain too, and we had scars that would never heal... but we never had to worry about who to kill or we will be killed by tomorrow.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: At the very least, we could live, or at least pretend to.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: When the Sarkaz came, our lives got a little harder. When the factories were handed over, our lives got harder again.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: But the way I see it, I consider us still more or less lucky enough.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: Just what is your definition of 'lucky enough?'
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: Being able to stand here and talk about the past.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: But now our luck has come to an end. No one can keep winning the lottery forever.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: But so what? Most people aren't lucky at all, and they still manage to find themselves a way out.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: Now go back to work, 'Big Deal in the Corps.' The chopper isn't going to pack itself up.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: Do what you should do, just as you promised me back then.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: Hm, now what did you say back then? 'I will walk into every night—'
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: Enough, Granny! I was still...
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: Regretting your lies now?
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: No.
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: I will do it. I will still do it.
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: Times like these, you look just like Harvey.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: Catherine looks at Feist with a sidelong glance before disappearing into the crowd. All around Feist, men dressed in all kinds of attire come and go. All of them are exhausted, but not a single one of them has given up.
Feist knows that all those who stand here are his most trustworthy allies.
This little comfort is better than nothing. As the idea crosses his mind, Feist breathes out a little and exercises his stiff arm after having been on edge for so long.
Once the mist fog that we call opportunities, luck, and other nouns disperses, what form will life take this time?
Feist decides to stop speculating and to instead experience it himself.
Feist—
attributes.name: Rockrock

attributes.content: The wounded are all in position. Now we just have to take the maintenance access and leave Londinium, and we'll be safe for the time being.
attributes.name: Rockrock

attributes.content: We'll rebuild Squad 11 of the Self-Salvation Corps when that time comes, right?
attributes.name: Rockrock

attributes.content: Of course. I promise you.
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: Let's go.
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: Suddenly, Feist feels a faint tremor.
What's... going on?
attributes.name: Rockrock

attributes.content: In the distance, the exit and entrance of this underground structure gradually begin to close at the same time.
Why is the passage getting sealed off? Did the Sarkaz find us?!
attributes.name: Rockrock

attributes.content: Damn it! Catherine and Clovisia are both over at the entrance!
attributes.name: Rockrock

attributes.content: No, I've been listening in on the Sarkaz communication channels around us. We shouldn't be exposed.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Uh, it can't be a wiring problem, right?
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: No, these passageways have manually controlled gates. I checked before entering, and I didn't see any problems with the drive system.
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: Feist has very good eyes, and he has always been very proud of this fact. This is pretty rare in the factories, where lighting is always needed for the workers to actually do anything.
Yet at this very moment, he would rather not have seen what he saw so clearly.
At the other end of the entrance, beyond the gap that is about to shut, he spots a few familiar silhouettes.
The silhouettes flash by until the gate closes completely and the last ray of light disappears behind its iron frame.
Until darkness engulfs all of them.
Feist tries his best to regain his footing. He feels the taste of blood spread throughout his mouth.
He tries to swallow this blood stench but finds himself unable to. He can't.
This isn't part of the plan!
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Who's over there on that side of the passage? What are they trying to do?!
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: What's the matter, Feist? Are... Are your lips bleeding...?
attributes.name: Rockrock

attributes.content: I know who it was on the other side.
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: They.... They're my friends. The factory workers of Munitions Factory No. 11.
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: They said they were going to check if there was any equipment left that we could take.
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: They're the only ones who could've closed the gate.
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: ...Tommy.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: Catherine, this... this wasn't my idea! We all decided this together!
attributes.name: Londinium Worker A

attributes.content: Just like when you saved me?
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: That's a whole separate thing, Catherine!
attributes.name: Londinium Worker B

attributes.content: Tommy, get back to work. Find a Defense Forces soldier and tell him what happened here.
attributes.name: Londinium Worker B

attributes.content: A-Alright! I know where they are!
attributes.name: Londinium Worker A

attributes.content: I have to say, your kidnapping skills are far worse than the Sarkaz.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: I'm not trying to look for trouble with you, Catherine. How many years have we known each other? There's no surprises here.
attributes.name: Londinium Worker B

attributes.content: But we don't want to die in the Londinium countryside, killed by those monsters' Arts either!
attributes.name: Londinium Worker B

attributes.content: I'm just a foundry worker! I can use the furnace, the choppers, and I can cast some passable parts.
attributes.name: Londinium Worker B

attributes.content: But now they want us to leave the city and fight a war with the dukes and the Sarkaz? You've got to be kidding. Out of all the things that I've ever held in my hands, the only thing that even remotely looks like weapon is my spanner!
attributes.name: Londinium Worker B

attributes.content: Catherine, I promise. It'll all be fine. I have an uncle who's in the Defense Forces. I can talk to him, see if he can plead on the factory workers' behalf.
attributes.name: Londinium Worker B

attributes.content: What about the things we've done? We attacked the Sarkaz.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: We can say that it was the Self-Salvation Corps who did it. We had no choice.
attributes.name: Londinium Worker B

attributes.content: Hah, and you think they'll believe you?
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: We may face harsher treatment after this... but as long as the dukes win this war, we can go back to our lives before!
attributes.name: Londinium Worker B

attributes.content: We forged Londinium with our own hands!
attributes.name: Londinium Worker B

attributes.content: Everything will get better.
attributes.name: Londinium Worker B

attributes.content: You didn't used to lick the nobles' boots like this.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: What choice do I have, Catherine?! Tell me. What choice do I have?!
attributes.name: Londinium Worker B

attributes.content: I... I just don't want to leave my home. I just want to walk on the streets of Londinium again, maybe play ball with my friends every now and then.
attributes.name: Londinium Worker B

attributes.content: ...I don't want to die in a shell crater in the countryside, with my arms and legs all blown off. I've seen it before.
attributes.name: Londinium Worker B

attributes.content: The Sarkaz... They will only get more and more brutal. My daughter might not even be able to put my dead body back together.
attributes.name: Londinium Worker B

attributes.content: Go, Catherine. I don't want to be rough with you.
attributes.name: Londinium Worker B

attributes.content: As for you, little leader of the resistance...
attributes.name: Londinium Worker B

attributes.content: Hm? Where did she go?
attributes.name: Londinium Worker B

attributes.content: There is only a rope that has been cut in the spot where Clovisia used to be.
Huh? She was here just a minute ago! Where'd she...?
attributes.name: Londinium Worker C

attributes.content: You mean to tell me you couldn't keep eyes on a little girl?
attributes.name: Londinium Worker B

attributes.content: I-It has to be some kind of Arts!
attributes.name: Londinium Worker C

attributes.content: Whatever... Let her go. I heard she's just the daughter of a tailor.
attributes.name: Londinium Worker B

attributes.content: I just hope that she'll find a hiding place in Londinium's dark night.
attributes.name: Londinium Worker B

attributes.content: ...It stinks.
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: How many people do you think have died the last couple days?
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: Don't take the alley to the north. A few Infected went kaboom there yesterday. There's Originium dust everywhere.
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: Those Sarkaz bastards! Their plan was always to trap us in here and have us fend for ourselves!
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: You went to the transport union during the day. What did Marshall say?
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: The place got burned down. There are nothing but steel beams left. I don't know if Marshall was in the pile of dead bodies. I didn't try to look.
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: Porties can't all be idiots and wimps, right?
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: All this is... is us taking a punch directly, and we're still dazed.
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: Once we come round, Norport Borough will bounce back!
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: Perhaps the dukes will make it here soon. When the time comes...
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: What? When did you start worshipping the dukes? Are you hiding the Duke of Wellington's bloody autograph in your drawer now or something?
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: We have to count on ourselves!
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: We can leave this place. I will lead the charge, I swear!
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: The last time you swore anything, you told me you would never fall asleep while you stood night watch.
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: I was just...!
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: Enough. Before we start dreaming, we have to find ourselves something to eat.
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: We have Delphine and her tendency to hoard to thank for keeping the gym's storerooms well stocked.
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: Otherwise, we would likely be in this pile of dead bodies, too.
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: Cador, they're fighting up ahead again.
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: Ugh, not here too...
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: Let's take another route. The restaurants at the loading area might still have some supplies.
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: We could try to buy something... or trade.
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: What will you do if they don't want to sell?
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: You brought a weapon.
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: This is just for defense. We won't use it.
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: Things... have yet to get that bad.
attributes.name: Cador
